<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public class arrayex1 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
        ArrayList<Integer> numbers = new ArrayList<Integer>();
        System.out.println("Enter numbers: ");
        for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
            int num = input.nextInt();
            numbers.add(num);
        }
        System.out.println(findMin(numbers, 0, numbers.get(0)) + " <== Smallest number");
    }

    public static int findMin(ArrayList<Integer> n, int index, int min) {
        if(index == n.size()) {
            return min;
        }
        if(n.get(index) < min) {
            min = n.get(index);
        }
        return findMin(n, index + 1, min);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The findMin method is now a recursive method that takes an ArrayList of integers, an index, and a minimum value as parameters. It checks if the current index is equal to the size of the ArrayList, in which case it returns the minimum value. If not, it checks if the value at the current index is less than the current minimum value, and if so, updates the minimum value. It then calls itself with the updated index and minimum value.
